discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Option B is correct because using a unique integration user for each external system integration follows the principle of least privilege and allows for auditing of each system’s activities.

Option D is incorrect because while using a Connected App for each external system integration follows the principle of least privilege, it does not provide a way to audit the activities of the external systems. The auditing requirement can be met by using a unique integration user for each system.

questions.question_text:
Northern Trail Outfitters wants to use Salesforce as a front end for creating accounts using the lead-to-opportunity process.
1. An order is created in Salesforce when the opportunity is Closed/Won, but the back-end Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system is the data master for order.
2. Customer wants to be able to see within Salesforce all the stages of order processing like Order Created, Orden Shipped, and Order Paid that are within the retention window.

Which two message durability considerations should an integration architect make when designing a solution to meet these business requirements? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
Option C is not necessarily wrong, but it might not be the best choice in this context. When subscribing to the Salesforce Event Bus, using a ReplayID with a value of -1 will only allow you to see new events. This means that any events that were published before the subscription was established will not be seen.

In the context of the question, where the requirement is to see all stages of order processing within the retention window, using a ReplayID with a value of -2 (as in Option B) would be more appropriate. This is because a ReplayID of -2 allows you to replay all events from the last 72 hours, which would include both old and new events.

However, if the requirement was only to see new events from the point of subscription onwards, then Option C would be a correct choice.
